gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 14,1]]On a sabbath Jesus went to dine at the home of one of the leading Pharisees, and the people there were observing him carefully.
[[Lc 14,2]]In front of him there was a man suffering from dropsy.
[[Lc 14,3]]Jesus spoke to the scholars of the law and Pharisees in reply, asking, "Is it lawful to cure on the sabbath or not?"
[[Lc 14,4]]But they kept silent; so he took the man and, after he had healed him, dismissed him.
[[Lc 14,5]]Then he said to them, "Who among you, if your son or ox falls into a cistern, would not immediately pull him out on the sabbath day?"
[[Lc 14,6]]But they were unable to answer his question.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 111,1]]I will give thanks to the LORD with all my heart 
in the company and assembly of the just.
[[Ps 111,2]]Great are the works of the LORD, 
exquisite in all their delights.

[[Ps 111,3]]Majesty and glory are his work, 
and his justice endures forever.
[[Ps 111,4]]He has won renown for his wondrous deeds; 
gracious and merciful is the LORD.

[[Ps 111,5]]He has given food to those who fear him; 
He will forever be mindful of his covenant.
[[Ps 111,6]]He has made known to his people the power of his works, 
giving them the inheritance of the nations.

first_reading.title: Letter to the Philippians
first_reading.text:
[[Ph 1,1]]Paul and Timothy, slaves of Christ Jesus, to all the holy ones in Christ Jesus who are in Philippi, with the overseers and ministers:
[[Ph 1,2]]grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
[[Ph 1,3]]I give thanks to my God at every remembrance of you,
[[Ph 1,4]]praying always with joy in my every prayer for all of you,
[[Ph 1,5]]because of your partnership for the gospel from the first day until now.
[[Ph 1,6]]I am confident of this, that the one who began a good work in you will continue to complete it until the day of Christ Jesus.
[[Ph 1,7]]It is right that I should think this way about all of you, because I hold you in my heart, you who are all partners with me in grace, both in my imprisonment and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel.
[[Ph 1,8]]For God is my witness, how I long for all of you with the affection of Christ Jesus.
[[Ph 1,9]]And this is my prayer: that your love may increase ever more and more in knowledge and every kind of perception,
[[Ph 1,10]]to discern what is of value, so that you may be pure and blameless for the day of Christ,
[[Ph 1,11]]filled with the fruit of righteousness that comes through Jesus Christ for the glory and praise of God.
